entry.answer: An "akshauhini" was a massive military division in the Mahabharata, consisting of 21,840 chariots, 21,840 elephants, 65,520 horses, and 109,200 soldiers. The text mentions that Duryodhana's army had seven akshauhinis, while the Pandavas had one. This unit symbolized the vast scale of the Kurukshetra war, emphasizing the epic's grandeur.
